BL_BS_B1.text: one person holds up an umbrella and another woman stands behind him.The following day, I was invited to attend my first ever Chinese New Year's celebration (the "New Year" part). The event took place inside a restaurant called Yum Cha , which means 'new year' or 'year of new beginnings'. It had all the trappings that you would expect from such a party: lots more people than usual; dancing music playing throughout the night; fireworks going off around midnight ; everyone dressed like their favorite characters - Han Solo, Princess Leia etc. There were also many decorations including lanterns hanging down by the doorways decorated with colorful flowers .

BL_BS_B1.text: two men sit under an umbrella as they watch someone walk by , one says "you're not going to believe this"The following day, I went out for lunch. The restaurant was packed but there were no signs or anything that indicated it would be crowded when we arrived: just tables set up along the wall where you could order food from various places (the menu included fish tacos). There wasn't even any sign saying so; all customers had their own table marked down below theirs which meant everyone sat together without being separated into groups like most restaurants do today. It's hard enough getting your meal ordered if nobody else does either! We got our orders quickly because my husband wanted something spicy – he said his favorite dish here was chicken wings -and then asked me what kind of sauce she used instead of soy milk : sesame oil !

BL_BS_B1.text: two men sit under an umbrella as they watch someone walk by , one says "you're not going to believe this"The following day, I went out for lunch. The restaurant was packed but there were no signs or anything that indicated it would be crowded when we arrived: just tables set up along the wall where you could order food from various places (the menu included fish tacos). There wasn't even any sign saying so; all customers had their own table marked down below theirs which meant everyone sat together without being separated into groups like most restaurants do today. It's hard enough getting your meal ordered if nobody else does either! We got our orders quickly because my husband wanted something spicy – he said his favorite dish here was chicken wings -and then asked me what kind of sauce she used instead of soy milk : sesame oil !

BL_BS_B1.text: he first thing that struck me about this scene was how it seemed like we were watching two different stories. The story told here, as I understand it from my own experience with wilderness survival training (and also through reading books), is one where you're trying not only survive but thrive within your environment; there's no way out for anyone except yourself – so if something goes wrong at any point during these experiences, they can't just go back into their comfort zone again without having some sort "fix" ready when things get tough. This seems very much true: even though most folks will never have experienced anything quite like what happened today, many do know someone whose life changed forever because he did exactly what others would've done anyway! And yet somehow all those years spent learning everything possible didn' t seem to make them more resilient than everyone else? It felt almost too easy…like our lives had been scripted before us….
